alert.note: Alert for Garfield (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 5:32PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Garfield. In west central Colorado, Mesa. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Even though storms have moved away from the area, small stream flooding is still possible. Between 0.3 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Wiesse Creek, Potts Creek, Clear Creek, Little Horsethief Creek, Dry Fork Roan Creek, Tom Creek, Kimball Creek, Colorado River, Willow Creek, Logan Wash, Brush Creek, Conn Creek and Roan Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
